gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Fluorescence data collected by the AUV Honey Badger (Wave Glider) in the North Pacific gyre in 2015 (MAGI project)

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration - Southwest Fisheries Science Center

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Honey Badger (Wave Glider) fluorescence data collected in the North Pacific gyre in 2015 Dataset Description: <p>This dataset includes chlorophyll, phycoerythrin, and CDOM data from the&nbsp;AUV Honey Badger (Wave Glider model V2). &nbsp;Data were&nbsp;collected in the&nbsp;North Pacific gyre from May to November in 2015.</p><p>&nbsp;</p> Acquisition Description: <p>Data were collected at the surface by the the AUV Honey Badger (a&nbsp;Wave Glider® model SV2&nbsp;from Liquid Robotics). &nbsp;This deployment&nbsp;in the North Pacific Ocean&nbsp;is part of&nbsp;Project MAGI. &nbsp;For more details about the Honey Badger and project MAGI please see project page:</p><p><a href="http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/#">http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/</a></p><p>Chlorophyll, phycoerythrin, and CDOM data were aquired&nbsp;from two&nbsp;float-mounted&nbsp;<a href="http://www.turnerdesigns.com/" target="_blank">Turner Designs'</a><a href="http://2 Turner float-mounted C3 fluorometers equipped for chl, phycoerythrin and CDOM. Sensor returned only RFU. No calibration was deemed useful due to the duration of the mission and nature of questions asked. http://www.turnerdesigns.com/products/submersible-fluorometer/c3-submersible-fluorometer">&nbsp;C3™ Submersible Fluorometers</a>. &nbsp;Biofouling is a big issue for any long deployment vehicle, and having two sensors provided the redundancy needed for data quality assurance.&nbsp;&nbsp;No calibration was deemed useful due to the duration of the mission and nature of questions asked.</p>

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Marine Science Institute and Dept. of Marine Science 750 Channel View Dr.

If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Long Duration AUVs as tools to explore Mesoscale feature aggregate interactions (MAGI)

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: Long Duration AUVs as tools to explore Mesoscale feature aggregate interactions (MAGI)

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Description from NSF award abstract:Remote areas of the ocean are difficult to sample for short-lived or episodic features. This project will use a new sampling platform, the Wave Glider, and provide a continuous presence in the central North Pacific gyre. The six month duration of the mission will allow repeated sampling as well as spatial coverage previously unavailable. This mission will incorporate phytoplankton specific sensors as well as a set of optical sensors that will provide information on distribution, physiology and aggregation of a unique diatom-nitrogen fixing cyanobacterium symbiosis. When completed, this program will have generated the first data sets that follow these diatom blooms over extended periods in the region. Access to this instrumentation was facilitated by the PacX challenge, an international competition to produce high quality research from long-duration autonomous vehicles in the North and South Pacific Ocean. As a result of winning that competition, the principal investigator has been awarded the use of 6 months of the Honey Badger Wave Glider time in 2014. The Wave Glider is a wave-powered surface vessel capable of extended duration missions. In order to maximize this the principal investigator will outfit the glider with advanced sensors to quantify zones of intense diatom activity and aggregation along mesoscale features in the Pacific (Project MAGI: Mesoscale feature-AGregate Interactions).Note: This project is funded by an NSF RAPID award.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z' http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/CPHLPM01/ Name: Concentration of chlorophyll-a {chl-a} per unit volume of the water body [particulate phase] by in-situ chlorophyll fluorometer and manufacturer's calibration applied Description: In-situ fluorometer with manufacturer calibration applied. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PHYCSPP4/ Name: Concentration of phycoerythrin per unit volume of the water body [particulate 0.6-2um phase] by filtration and spectrophotometry Description: Spectrophotometry (0.6 to 2um pore filtered size fraction) http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/TEMPP901/ Name: Temperature (ITS-90) of the water body Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Time (UTC) in format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Latitude; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude; west is negative; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Concentration of chlorophyll-a {chl-a} per unit volume of the water body [particulate phase] by in-situ chlorophyll fluorometer and manufacturer's calibration applied

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Chlorophyll fluorescence; General Description: fluorescence; indirect measure of pigment concentration; possibly calibrated against extracted pigment concentrations; units may vary with dataset; for US JGOFS fluorescence as measured from CTD instrument sensor NERC Description: In-situ fluorometer with manufacturer calibration applied.
PI-supplied Description: Colored dissolved organic matter; General Description: Colored dissolved organic matter (CDOM): The optically measurable component of the dissolved organic matter in water

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Concentration of phycoerythrin per unit volume of the water body [particulate 0.6-2um phase] by filtration and spectrophotometry

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Phycoerythrin; red protein pigments; General Description: phycoerythrin; red protein pigments NERC Description: Spectrophotometry (0.6 to 2um pore filtered size fraction)

PI-supplied Description: Temerature; General Description: water temperature at measurement depth NERC Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard.

Sensor returned only RFU. No calibration was deemed useful due to the duration of the mission and nature of questions asked. http://www.turnerdesigns.com/products/submersible-fluorometer/c3-submersible-fluorometer">&nbsp;C3™ Submersible Fluorometers</a>. &nbsp;Biofouling is a big issue for any long deployment vehicle, and having two sensors provided the redundancy needed for data quality assurance.&nbsp;&nbsp;No calibration was deemed useful due to the duration of the mission and nature of questions asked.</p>

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: fluorometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:Turner float-mounted C3 fluorometers equipped for chl, phycoerythrin and CDOM.For more details see:http://www.turnerdesigns.com/products/submersible-fluorometer/c3-submers... Instrument Name: Fluorometer Instrument Short Name:Fluorometer Instrument Description: A fluorometer or fluorimeter is a device used to measure parameters of fluorescence: its intensity and wavelength distribution of emission spectrum after excitation by a certain spectrum of light. The instrument is designed to measure the amount of stimulated electromagnetic radiation produced by pulses of electromagnetic radiation emitted into a water sample or in situ. This instrument designation is used when specific make and model are not known. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/113/
